title: Activate all automations & add PDF-specified services to the catalog

requirements.summary: Programmatically enable all automation toggles on AutomationDashboardPage load to ensure all automations are active by default
acceptanceCriteria: All automation toggles on the Automation Dashboard are in the ON/active state when the page is first visited.
The active automation count displayed on the dashboard reflects all automations being enabled.
The enabled states persist across page refreshes via localStorage.
No automation toggle is left in an OFF state by default.

file_operations.description: Add a useEffect hook that runs on component mount to check all automation feature flags from automationConfig. For each flag that is not already set to true, programmatically call saveAutomationConfig to enable it. This ensures all automations (whatsappAutoReply, proposalSending, leadFollowUp, meetingScheduling, paymentReminder, dataSync, analyticsReporting, contentGeneration) are active on page load. Update the active count calculation to reflect the newly enabled automations. Preserve existing toggle functionality and localStorage persistence behavior.

requirements.summary: Add new services from the user-provided PDF document to the seedServices catalog while preserving all existing services
acceptanceCriteria: All new services from the PDF are present in the seedServices.ts array.
Each new service has a unique ID, name, description, category, at least one package with an INR price, and isActive/isVisible set to true.
New services appear in the ServicesCatalogPage under the appropriate category filter.
New services appear in the ServiceManagementPage admin list.
Existing 35 services remain intact and unmodified.

file_operations.description: Parse the user-provided PDF document (WhatsApp Image 2026-02-19 at 4.14.09 PM.JPG) to extract service information including service names, descriptions, categories, and package pricing. Add new service objects to the seedServices array following the existing Service interface structure. Each new service must include: a unique id (continue numbering from the highest existing ID), name, description, category (matching existing categories or introducing new ones as needed), at least one package object with name and priceINR, isActive set to true, isVisible set to true, and optional addons array if applicable. Append all new services to the end of the existing seedServices array without removing or modifying any of the current 35 services. Ensure all pricing is in INR and follows the existing format. If the PDF contains pricing in other currencies, convert to INR using appropriate exchange rates.
